pull.title: Add 'settxfee' RPC, to change TX fee setting at runtime

events.body: Yeah, trying to future proof it a bit.  Can remove, if you really don't like that.
This is good, since it sure beats restarting bitcoind. But.. I'm going to open a new issue.

Is it true that <amount> is rounded to the nearest 0.01?  I don't think AmountFromValue does that any more...
While you're fixing that, remove the future-proof-CriticalSection, too, please.
re AmountFromValue: that was copied from elsewhere in rpc.cpp...  sendfrom, maybe?  I'd like to be consistent one way or the other :)
Fixed sendtoaddress/sendfrom: 8adcf8 / src/rpc.cpp : Help for sendtoaddress/sendfrom was wrong: amounts are rounded to 0.00000001

events.message: Add settxfee RPC, to permit setting default TX fee at runtime.

comments.body: Why the critsect?  "coding ahead" in anticipation of multithreaded RPC?
